content: used for seaming it together seam together with the leftover cast-off tail using mattress stitch once you ve finished seaming lightly pull on the tail you were sewing with to naturally create a curve in the leaf original credit cryptious on ravelry please don t republish elsewhere without my consent if found elsewhere this content should be free of charge if you want to skip the leaves/make a more minimal design or hangable decoration you can also use the green yarn and tie it into two loops at the top of the project it s good if you re on a bit of a time limit as the project shown directly below was when completed or only have scrap yarn to make it with construction separate the main body segments into 2 groups of 5 each group of 5 will be one half/side of the project using the cast-on tail of each segment connect the corner of another segment together original credit cryptious on ravelry please don t republish elsewhere without my consent if found elsewhere this content should be free of charge repeat this process so all 5 segments are linked at the corner there might be a lot of stray tails while you re doing this so remember to double check you re sewing with the right one when you ve connected 5 segments like this it should look something like this flip the work over so it s wrong face up using the cast-on tail seam up the edge where it increases i recommend using mattress stitch for this part if you re using a sewing needle alternative methods of seaming would be using a crochet hook to do a flat slip_stitch seam remember you only sew up to the part where the increases stop don t sew the decrease portion of the segments just yet original credit cryptious on ravelry please don t republish elsewhere without my consent if found elsewhere this content should be free of charge repeat for all corner sections with the cast-on tail if it s still relatively long enough to use for more sewing then don t cut it off just yet it can be used further into the construction process when you re finished the project should look like this wrong side and right side respectively shown after this process you should have two identical halves that look like the above place both halves right side to right side so the wrong side should be shown outwards if you re struggling to keep these in place you can use a safety pin to hold it in place or tie the remaining cast-on tails together into a knot to hold it in place original credit cryptious on ravelry please don t republish elsewhere without my consent if found elsewhere this content should be free of charge using the cast-off tail on the tip of each segment start seaming together the outer sides of the project if you run out of cast-off
